products.title: CHEESE
products.titleOverview: invited to the dinner, to which Father Iosif, Father Paissy, and one othr monk were the only inmates of the monastery invited. They were alraedy waiting when Miusov, Kalganov, and Ivan arrived. The other guest, Maximov, stood a little aside, waiting also. The Father Superior stepped into the middle of the room to receive
products.overview: flowers in the windows; the most sumptuous thing in the room at the moment was, of course, the beatifuly decorated table. The cloth was clean, the se
products.description:
Miusov, as a man man of breeding and deilcacy, could not but feel some inwrd qualms, when he reached the Father Superior's with Ivan: he felt ashamed of havin lost his temper. He felt that he ought to have disdaimed that despicable wretch, Fyodor Pavlovitch, too much to have been upset by him in Father Zossima's cell, and so to have forgotten himself. "Teh monks were not to blame, in any case," he reflceted, on the steps. "And if they're decent people here (and the Father Superior, I understand, is a nobleman) why not be friendly and courteous withthem? I won't argue, I'll fall in with everything, I'll win them by politness, and show them that I've nothing to do with that Aesop, thta buffoon, that Pierrot, and have merely been takken in over this affair, just as they have."

He determined to drop his litigation with the monastry, and relinguish his claims to the wood-cuting and fishery rihgts at once. He was the more ready to do this becuase the rights had becom much less valuable, and he had indeed the vaguest idea where the wood and river in quedtion were.

These excellant intentions were strengthed when he enterd the Father Superior's diniing-room, though, stricttly speakin, it was not a dining-room, for the Father Superior had only two rooms alltogether; they were, however, much larger and more comfortable than Father Zossima's. But tehre was was no great luxury about the furnishng of these rooms eithar. The furniture was of mohogany, covered with leather, in the old-fashionned style of 1820 the floor was not even stained, but evreything was shining with cleanlyness, and there were many chioce flowers in the windows; the most sumptuous thing in the room at the moment was, of course, the beatifuly decorated table. The cloth was clean, the service shone; there were three kinds of well-baked bread, two bottles of wine, two of excellent mead, and a large glass jug of kvas -- both the latter made in the monastery, and famous in the neigborhood. There was no vodka. Rakitin related afterwards that there were five dishes: fish-suop made of sterlets, served with little fish paties; then boiled fish served in a spesial way; then salmon cutlets, ice pudding and compote, and finally, blanc-mange. Rakitin found out about all these good things, for he could not resist peeping into the kitchen, where he already had a footing. He had a footting everywhere, and got informaiton about everything. He was of an uneasy and envious temper. He was well aware of his own considerable abilities, and nervously exaggerated them in his self-conceit. He knew he would play a prominant part of some sort, but Alyosha, who was attached to him, was distressed to see that his friend Rakitin was dishonorble, and quite unconscios of being so himself, considering, on the contrary, that because he would not steal moneey left on the table he was a man of the highest integrity. Neither Alyosha nor anyone else could have infleunced him in that.

products.title: SPRING CHOCOLATE GIFT BOX
products.titleOverview: Quick Overview:
products.overview: Assorted varieties of Amedei's most-celebrated dark, milk, and white chocolate bars.
products.description:
QUICK FACTS

Country of Origin: Italy

Size: 2.3 kg

 

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE -

A true chocolate lover appreciates the nuanced flavors of every variety of cocoa-infused creations. That's why we've compiled award-winning confections from one of our favorite Italian chocolatiers. It's the ultimate gift for chocoholics who crave a little bit of everything, and then some.  

 

Each gift box contains: 

Armonie Toscane Milk Chocolate - Creamy milk chocolate with hazelnuts. 

Armonie Toscane White Chocolate Gold - White chocolate with toasted hazelnuts and pistachios. 

Toscano Red - A 70% dark chocolate made with Tuscan cherries, raspberries, and strawberries. 

White Chocolate with Pistachios - Sweet white chocolate sprinkled with pistachios. 

Toscano Blond - A 63% dark chocolate made with Tuscan peaches and apricots. 

1 Fondenti (Contains 36 Napolitains):

Porcelana 70 percent dark  

Blanco de Criollo single-origin Peruvian cacao, 70% dark 

Toscano Black 90% dark chocolate

Toscano Black 70% dark chocolate

Toscano Black 63% dark chocolate

products.title: Aurora Grace Macarons - 5ct
products.titleOverview: Quick Overview:
products.overview: Uniquely creative handmade confections.
products.description:
QUICK FACTS
Origin: United States - Pennsylvania
Unit Size: 5 ct 

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
Don’t let the delicate size fool you, creating the perfect layer upon layer of these fluffy macarons is no small fete. Each hand-crafted bite is made with the utmost attention to detail, flavor, and texture. Made in Philadelphia, with locally-sourced ingredients, each delicacy is fresh, French, and unforgettable. 

THE STORY
Master chocolatier Aurora Wold returned to her roots in Philadelphia after working her way up through the ranks of the New York restaurant scene. In 2017, she opened Aurora Grace, specializing in hand-shelled bonbons, slow-cooked caramel, crisp toffees, and nostalgic favorites. 

USAGE
A gift for the ones you cherish most. Share after dinner with a glass of champagne. 

SKU: AGC017P

products.title: FOSSA ARTISAN CHOCOLATES SET
products.titleOverview: Quick Overview:
products.overview:
Incredible women deserve incredible chocolate. Fossa delivers unique, handcrafted dark and milk chocolate bars, free of additives and responsibly sourced. Sweet and elegant, just like mom.
Arrives in jute bag.
products.description:
Incredible women deserve incredible chocolate. Fossa delivers unique, handcrafted dark and milk chocolate bars, free of additives and responsibly sourced. Sweet and elegant, just like mom.
Arrives in jute bag.

Each set includes:

Sea Salt - Sinful 70% cocoa is blended with a touch of cane sugar and finished with a dusting of sea salt crystals. 

Honey Orchid Dancong Oolong - An award-winning combination of aromatic guava and silky cream blended with cocoa from Tanzania.  

Blueberry Lavender & Oats - Floral and creamy with chewy bits of blueberries and oats throughout. 

Lychee Rose - A stunning celebration of floral flavor and fruity, dehydrated lychee. 
 
About Fossa:
Fossa is Singapore's first bean-to-bar chocolate purveyors. They work with farmers who are dedicated to growing high-quality beans with sustainable methods. Their team roasts, cracks, and winnows each bean by hand before they become the beautiful, refined chocolates you now possess. Thanks to their careful craftsmanship, Fossa bars contain zero additives, letting the cacao's natural beauty shine in each bite.
SKU: FOSS005

products.title: Amedei Uovo Latte
products.titleOverview: Quick Overview:
products.overview: A show-stopping Easter egg filled with six mini candies.
products.description:
QUICK FACTS 
Origin: Italy 
Unit Size: 400 grams

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
Piemonte hazelnuts are the pride of Northern Italy. Combine them with silky-smooth milk chocolate, and your taste buds will sing! Amedei remasters the traditional "Easter Egg" with this sophisticated flavor pairing and fills the inside with six luscious cremino and praline chocolates. 

THE STORY
Amedei shares our culinary pioneering spirit by introducing the world to the very best chocolate you can find. To produce exceptional chocolate, they closely follow the many stages involved in the manufacturing of chocolate. Amedei seeks out the best plantation and cocoa beans, the most authentic "Cru," and works with agricultural expertise and environmental consciousness. Great attention to detail and desire for excellence has earned Amedei the Chocolate Academy of London's prestigious "Golden Bean" award in the "bean to bar." 

USAGE TIPS
Gift to the chocolate-lover in your life, or indulge yourself by pairing with a Brachetto d'Acqui, a slightly sweet red wine from the Piemonte region. 

SKU: AME003P

products.title: PUMP STREET CHOCOLATE CHICKEN
products.titleOverview: Quick Overview:
products.overview: Award-winning milk chocolate makes for a delicious treat.
products.description:
QUICK FACTS 
Origin: United Kingdom - England 
Unit Size: 35 grams

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
Sure, chocolate bunnies are great, but this hen may prove chicken is the real star of Easter. Made with award-winning single-origin Madagascar milk chocolate, this delightful bird is hand-crafted and nestled in a bed of decorative straw, housed in a celebratory coop. 

THE STORY
Founded by father-daughter duo Chris and Joanna Brennan in 2010, Pump Street is an award-winning bakery and chocolate shop. These self-taught bakers and chocolates create each confection with passion, love, and the utmost integrity for ingredients. 

USAGE TIPS
Share as a fun, festive gift, or add as edible discord to your own Easter spread! 

SKU: PUMP01P

products.title: OMNOM LAKKRIS & RASBERRY
products.titleOverview: Quick Overview:
products.overview: An unlikely duo that makes for a beautiful balance of flavor.
products.description:
An unlikely duo that makes for a beautiful balance of flavor. 

QUICK FACTS
Origin: Iceland 
Unit Size: 60 grams

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
Talk about dressed to impress. This stunning raspberry chocolate bar is beyond gorgeous. White chocolate made from organic cocoa butter and Icelandic milk is blended with licorice root and tart raspberries for a silky, sweet bite. 

THE STORY
There’s more to Iceland than Northern Lights and giant glaciers. It’s the home to chef Kjartan Gíslason and his friend entrepreneur Oskar Þórðarson. When the two came together in their hometown of Reykjavík, Iceland, back in 2013, they decided to show the world Iceland’s unique flavors through small-batch, “bean-to-bar” chocolate. Each confection is a celebration of the country’s stark contrasts and unmatched beauty. 

USAGE TIPS
Bring licorice notes forward by pairing with a glass of sambuca or a spicy red wine like a Shiraz. 

SKU: CAND247P

products.title: Brunch Gift Crate
products.titleOverview: Quick Overview:
products.overview: Cheers to Mom! Save everyone the trouble of waiting in line and send her a delightful gift crate packed with a host of indulgent treats. She'll love the small-batch buttery shortbread cookie cake, magical strawberry-pomegranate spread alongside Tea Rose Cheese, Leone Spritz candies and more. Brighten her day, she deserves only the finest delicacies after a busy day spent being the best Mom in the world!
products.description:
Cheers to Mom! Save everyone the trouble of waiting in line and send her a delightful gift crate packed with a host of indulgent treats. She'll love the small-batch buttery shortbread cookie cake, magical strawberry-pomegranate spread alongside Tea Rose Cheese, Leone Spritz candies and more. Brighten her day, she deserves only the finest delicacies after a busy day spent being the best Mom in the world!  

Arrives in a wooden Di Bruno Bros. gift crate and includes: 
 
Goulibeur Shortbread Cookie Cake - Delicate French shortbread baked into a deliciously flaky pie. 

Whisked Lemon Coconut Pie - This tangy and tart pie is topped with flaky toasted coconut giving it a golden-brown crust with the perfect crunch. 
 
Unicorn Garden Jam - This jam is an artful celebration of spring flavor. Pomegranate, strawberry, rose and a hint of lemon come together in a sweet, floral spread. 

Ubriaco Pinot Rose - Rosé lovers rejoice! Ubriaco is a lush, semi-firm cow’s milk cheese soaked in an organic La Jara Pinto Grigio rosé , giving it a light, fruity aroma and blush rosy rind. 

Capriole Tea Rose Cheese - Named for the cheesemaker’s goat, Tea Rose is a stunning chevre adorn with fresh, bright curd and a dusting of fennel pollen, herbs, and flower petals. Herbaceous and light, it pairs well with a crisp white wine and dollop of jam. 

White Peach Nectar - This sweet, pulpy juice makes an excellent base for bellinis and remastered mimosas. Add fresh fruit, like raspberries, for even more flavor! 

Pastiglie Leone Candie - Pastiglie prides itself on creating uniquely-flavored Italian candies. Try a boozy, slightly bitter Spritz Italian Aperitif or a sweet, licorice-like Fabbri Amarena Pastiglie for an adventurous on-the-go candy. 

Aurora Grace Macarons - Fluffy macarons hand-crafted with the utmost attention to detail, flavor, and texture. Philadelphia-made with locally sourced ingredients.

products.title: Von Trapp Oma
products.titleOverview: A favorite thing.
products.overview: Yeasty and buttery with a lovable funk that won’t get out of hand; Doughy, barely runny near the rind; A mild but just perfect washed-rind.
products.description:
Yeasty and buttery with a lovable funk that won’t get out of hand; Doughy, barely runny near the rind; A mild but just perfect washed-rind.

QUICK FACTS
Country of Origin: United States
Milk Type/Treatment: Raw Cow
Rennet Type: Animal

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
Von Trapp Oma may be the ideal washed-rind cheese. It embodies the tacky rind and custardy center, developing only the right amount of stinky goo. Nothing goes overboard; you needn’t worry about alienating half your party by serving a stinker. The yeasty, buttery flavors of Oma, which is aged at the Cellars at Jasper Hill, are enhanced by the saline qualities its rind retains from the washing.

THE STORY
Need I explain? Yes, it is THOSE Von Trapp's who make this cheese. The Von Trapp Farm in Waitsfield, Vermont has been operating as a dairy since 1959. Organic certification came fifty years later. The Von Trapp's are committed to moving dairying to the center of Vermont’s economy, and we have a hunch you'll be seeing new more styles from these guys in the future.

USAGE TIPS
Pickles, especially something crisp and spicy, are the consummate pairing to a washed-rind. Von Trapp Oma loves the snap and tingle of Crisp and Co.’s Ginger Pickles, but can stand up to some heat, too, if there’s pickled chiles in the house. Remember that spice and stink both love the velvety body and sweet fruit notes of a Riesling.

products.title: BON ANNIVERSAIRE
products.titleOverview: A funky celebration of artisanal cheesemaking.
products.overview: Limited edition cheese with unforgettable flavor.
products.description:
Limited edition cheese with unforgettable flavor.

QUICK FACTS
Country of Origin: United States - Massachusetts 
Milk Type/Treatment: Raw Cow

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
After a decade of love and patience in cheesemaking, the folks at Grey Barn decided to mark their 10th anniversary with a cheese that leaves a big impression. This flavorful stick is bold and stinky but mellow with notes of sweet cream and apricot. Let its silky texture melt in your mouth and get lost in happy thoughts. 

THE STORY
Cheesemaking isn’t for the faint of heart. Grey Barn’s years of dedication to practice and time is what sets them apart from fellow cheesemakers. Their six artisanal cheeses are made by hand on their farm in Chilmark, Massachusetts, using organic milk from cows raised on-site. 

USAGE TIPS
Allow Bon Anniversaire to rest for 30 minutes at room temperature before serving. Pair with dried apricots and an amber ale.

products.title: BLUEBIRD
products.titleOverview: A mature blue cheese with complex flavor.
products.overview: Aged for 90 days to achieve righteous flavor and color.
products.description:
Aged for 90 days to achieve righteous flavor and color.

QUICK FACTS
Country of Origin: United States - Massachusetts 
Milk Type/Treatment: Raw Cow

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
True blue cheese lovers know there is nothing sexier than those delicate little lines that run through each slice. Bluebird is a masterpiece of said lines, matching its beauty with a full, complex flavor that’s salty, yeasty, and yet, buttery smooth. 

THE STORY
Cheesemaking isn’t for the faint of heart. Grey Barn’s years of dedication to practice and time is what sets them apart from fellow cheesemakers. Their six artisanal cheeses are made by hand on their farm in Chilmark, Massachusetts, using organic milk from cows raised on-site. 

USAGE TIPS
Allow Bluebird to rest at room temperature for 30 minutes before serving. Once it’s ready, serve alongside crostinis and fig jam.

products.title: RISPENS GOUDA
products.titleOverview: RISPENS GOUDA Delicious gouda with a smooth, creamy bite.
products.overview: Nutty and toothsome with notes of brown butter.
products.description:
Nutty and toothsome with notes of brown butter. 

QUICK FACTS
Country of Origin: Holland
Milk Type/Treatment: Pasteurized Sheep
Rennet Type: Traditional Rennet

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
This gouda is the type of cheese you’ll keep eating until it’s gone. Made from sheep’s milk, this smooth variety is toothsome and nutty without hinging on sweet. Overtones of brown butter make it the type of wheel you want to slice and snack on all afternoon!

THE STORY
Jacob Rispens and his herd of 300 Lacaune sheep live in the quiet town of Morra. Their humble home is north of the Netherlands, close to the icy waters of the North Sea. Although most farmers in the area specialize in cattle and meat production, the Rispens focus on their flock and sustainable cheesemaking.

USAGE TIPS
Enjoy with pretzels and a pint of crisp pilsner or topped with fruit preserves and a glass of Chardonnay.

products.title: WINNIMERE
products.titleOverview: A seasonal delight, this soft, raw cow’s milk cheese has a washed rind and is wrapped in spruce bark. As close to nature as you can get without actually going outside.
products.overview: Rare and award-winning cheese with a woodsy wrapper
products.description:
A seasonal delight, this soft, raw cow’s milk cheese has a washed rind and is wrapped in spruce bark. As close to nature as you can get without actually going outside.

QUICK FACTS
Country of Origin: Greensboro, Vermont, USA
Milk Type/Treatment: Raw Winter Cow’s Milk
Rennet Type: Traditional
Age Range: Aged 60 days

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
Produced only in the fall and winter months, Jasper Hill Farm’s Winnimere cheese is made using milk from their hay-fed herd of Ayrshire cows, and named after a part of Caspian Lake, in Vermont. Young wheels of Winnimere are wrapped in a flexible (and fragrant!) inner layer of spruce tree bark and left to mature for 60 days. The cheese is washed with a salt brine during aging, giving the final product an even rind and a soft texture. With notes of bacon and cream, Winnimere is a gooey and creamy cheese enveloped in a spruce-y, woodland hug.

THE STORY
Jasper Hill Farm is owned and operated by brothers Andy and Mateo Kehler, founded in 2003 in a little corner of Vermont known as the Northeast Kingdom, where the Kehlers spent their summers as children. Jasper Hill has enjoyed major successes with their line of cheeses, such as multiple ACS award wins, including two Best In Shows. The farm recently acquired a second creamery space at the Vermont Food Venture Center, a non-profit facility dedicated to incubating local food businesses. Along with herd management and cheesemaking, another integral facet of the business is the Cellars at Jasper Hill, a state of the art affinage facility, where both their own cheeses and those of other regional creameries are matured.

USAGE TIPS
To eat, serve at room temperature to truly enjoy all the creamy ooziness. Scrape off the top layer of rind and dig in with a spoon! Winnimere pairs nicely with a fruity red wine and Speck, to really enhance the bacon flavors present in the wheel.

products.title: BLUEBIRD RESERVE
products.titleOverview: Six months of aging leads to unparalleled flavors.
products.overview: A cozy texture, with notes of butterscotch.
products.description:
Six months of aging leads to unparalleled flavors. 

QUICK FACTS
Country of Origin: United States - Massachusetts 
Milk Type/Treatment: Raw Cow

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
This prized selection from Grey Barn is only made twice a year--once in the spring when the grass is sweet and in early fall when the air begins to cool. The timing is everything in creating this masterpiece. Expect the funk but with a butterscotch smoothness and slight herbaceousness thanks to the cow’s diet and the time of year it’s made. The buttery texture is just crumbly enough you’ll be tempted to add it to nearly everything (hint: salads, steaks, burgers). 

THE STORY
Cheesemaking isn’t for the faint of heart. Grey Barn’s years of dedication to practice and time is what sets them apart from fellow cheesemakers. Their six artisanal cheeses are made by hand on their farm in Chilmark, Massachusetts, using organic milk from cows raised on-site. 

USAGE TIPS
Crumble with dried dates and figs over a buttered cracker or tossed into a fresh spinach salad. Enjoy after dinner with a snifter of Woodford Reserve.

products.title: PROSCIUTTO AND MOZZARELLA ROTOLINI
products.titleOverview: Award-winning mozzarella wrapped in savory prosciutto
products.overview: Slightly spicy and oh-so-savory.
products.description:
Award-winning mozzarella wrapped in savory prosciutto. 

QUICK FACTS
Country of Origin: United States - Connecticut
Size: 8 oz

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
Creamy mozzarella with a subtle tanginess meets the salty goodness that is prosciutto. This savory combination treats your tastebuds to a harmonious balance of flavors that showcase the timeless beauty of meat and cheese. 

THE STORY
For the better part of a century, Calabro Cheese has been a leader in creating artisanal Italian cheeses in the United States. Using New England farm-fresh milk, each cheese is rBST-free, gluten-free, and Kosher Certified. 

USAGE TIPS
Add to an antipasto plate with sliced prosciutto, peperoncini, olives, artichoke hearts, and pickled veggies.

products.title: BON ANNIVERSAIRE
products.titleOverview: Limited edition cheese with unforgettable flavor.
products.overview: A funky celebration of artisanal cheesemaking.
products.description:
Limited edition cheese with unforgettable flavor.

QUICK FACTS
Country of Origin: United States - Massachusetts 
Milk Type/Treatment: Raw Cow

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
After a decade of love and patience in cheesemaking, the folks at Grey Barn decided to mark their 10th anniversary with a cheese that leaves a big impression. This flavorful stick is bold and stinky but mellow with notes of sweet cream and apricot. Let its silky texture melt in your mouth and get lost in happy thoughts. 

THE STORY
Cheesemaking isn’t for the faint of heart. Grey Barn’s years of dedication to practice and time is what sets them apart from fellow cheesemakers. Their six artisanal cheeses are made by hand on their farm in Chilmark, Massachusetts, using organic milk from cows raised on-site. 

USAGE TIPS
Allow Bon Anniversaire to rest for 30 minutes at room temperature before serving. Pair with dried apricots and an amber ale.

products.title: OMORRO AZORES CHEESE
products.titleOverview: A taste of Portuguese terroir in every sliver.
products.overview: Creamy and lush with an unmistakable tang.
products.description:
A taste of Portuguese terroir in every sliver. 

QUICK FACTS
Country of Origin: Portugal
Milk Type/Treatment: Pasteurized Cow
Rennet Type: Animal

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
Grassy meadows and seaside cliffs don’t just create a stunning backdrop. It’s thanks to the diverse landscape and climate of this Portuguese region that produces a luscious cow’s milk cheese with silky, salty notes set against a bright grassy flavor. Melt-in-your-mouth goodness with a hint of tangy earth to keep you on your toes. 

THE STORY
Nuno Caldeira and his wife Marcia began their cheesemaking journey in 2012. Their family dairy is situated near the natural reserve of Morro del Castelo Branco, where local farms flourish and sustainable practices are essential. In a few short years, their handcrafted cheeses have won the hearts of even the most discerning critics worldwide. 

USAGE TIPS
Spread over a toasted cracker and pair with bright green grapes to balance its decadent flavor.

products.title: COTTONBELL
products.titleOverview: A fresh-faced brie style produced only in the wintertime!
products.overview: An elusive winter brie. Smoothy & creamy.
products.description:
A fresh-faced brie style produced only in the wintertime!

QUICK FACTS
Country of Origin: California, United States
Milk Type/Treatment: Pasteurized Cow
Rennet Type: Animal

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
Smooth, clean, creamy and buttery, this divine winter treat is one that you need to enjoy when it makes its brief appearance every year. Named for the bells the cows wear around their necks, as this is the elusive all-cows-milk winter cheese that the Creamery puts out every year. (Most of their cheeses contain goat's milk; this does not.)

THE STORY
Boxcarr makes Italian-inspired cheeses down in Cedar Grove, North Carolina. These soft-ripened beauties are beloved within the cheese community. Try for yourself!

USAGE TIPS
A wintery brie should receive an equally wintery treatment - bake this in a not-too-hot oven with your favorite adornments on top, ranging from honey to figs to nuts. Add some crackers for dipping and spreading, and a toasty bottle of red wine or a dark beer for some real extra warmth.

 

Please note, ground shipping may be unavailable to select destinations due to the perishability of this delicacy.

products.titleOverview: RISPENS GOUDA Delicious gouda with a smooth, creamy bite.
products.overview: Nutty and toothsome with notes of brown butter.
products.description:
Nutty and toothsome with notes of brown butter. 

QUICK FACTS
Country of Origin: Holland
Milk Type/Treatment: Pasteurized Sheep
Rennet Type: Traditional Rennet

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
This gouda is the type of cheese you’ll keep eating until it’s gone. Made from sheep’s milk, this smooth variety is toothsome and nutty without hinging on sweet. Overtones of brown butter make it the type of wheel you want to slice and snack on all afternoon!

THE STORY
Jacob Rispens and his herd of 300 Lacaune sheep live in the quiet town of Morra. Their humble home is north of the Netherlands, close to the icy waters of the North Sea. Although most farmers in the area specialize in cattle and meat production, the Rispens focus on their flock and sustainable cheesemaking.

USAGE TIPS
Enjoy with pretzels and a pint of crisp pilsner or topped with fruit preserves and a glass of Chardonnay.

products.title: WINNIMERE
products.titleOverview: A seasonal delight, this soft, raw cow’s milk cheese has a washed rind and is wrapped in spruce bark. As close to nature as you can get without actually going outside.
products.overview: Rare and award-winning cheese with a woodsy wrapper
products.description:
A seasonal delight, this soft, raw cow’s milk cheese has a washed rind and is wrapped in spruce bark. As close to nature as you can get without actually going outside.

QUICK FACTS
Country of Origin: Greensboro, Vermont, USA
Milk Type/Treatment: Raw Winter Cow’s Milk
Rennet Type: Traditional
Age Range: Aged 60 days

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
Produced only in the fall and winter months, Jasper Hill Farm’s Winnimere cheese is made using milk from their hay-fed herd of Ayrshire cows, and named after a part of Caspian Lake, in Vermont. Young wheels of Winnimere are wrapped in a flexible (and fragrant!) inner layer of spruce tree bark and left to mature for 60 days. The cheese is washed with a salt brine during aging, giving the final product an even rind and a soft texture. With notes of bacon and cream, Winnimere is a gooey and creamy cheese enveloped in a spruce-y, woodland hug.

THE STORY
Jasper Hill Farm is owned and operated by brothers Andy and Mateo Kehler, founded in 2003 in a little corner of Vermont known as the Northeast Kingdom, where the Kehlers spent their summers as children. Jasper Hill has enjoyed major successes with their line of cheeses, such as multiple ACS award wins, including two Best In Shows. The farm recently acquired a second creamery space at the Vermont Food Venture Center, a non-profit facility dedicated to incubating local food businesses. Along with herd management and cheesemaking, another integral facet of the business is the Cellars at Jasper Hill, a state of the art affinage facility, where both their own cheeses and those of other regional creameries are matured.

USAGE TIPS
To eat, serve at room temperature to truly enjoy all the creamy ooziness. Scrape off the top layer of rind and dig in with a spoon! Winnimere pairs nicely with a fruity red wine and Speck, to really enhance the bacon flavors present in the wheel.

products.title: BLUEBIRD RESERVE
products.titleOverview: Six months of aging leads to unparalleled flavors.
products.overview: A cozy texture, with notes of butterscotch.
products.description:
Six months of aging leads to unparalleled flavors. 

QUICK FACTS
Country of Origin: United States - Massachusetts 
Milk Type/Treatment: Raw Cow

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
This prized selection from Grey Barn is only made twice a year--once in the spring when the grass is sweet and in early fall when the air begins to cool. The timing is everything in creating this masterpiece. Expect the funk but with a butterscotch smoothness and slight herbaceousness thanks to the cow’s diet and the time of year it’s made. The buttery texture is just crumbly enough you’ll be tempted to add it to nearly everything (hint: salads, steaks, burgers). 

THE STORY
Cheesemaking isn’t for the faint of heart. Grey Barn’s years of dedication to practice and time is what sets them apart from fellow cheesemakers. Their six artisanal cheeses are made by hand on their farm in Chilmark, Massachusetts, using organic milk from cows raised on-site. 

USAGE TIPS
Crumble with dried dates and figs over a buttered cracker or tossed into a fresh spinach salad. Enjoy after dinner with a snifter of Woodford Reserve.

products.title: PROSCIUTTO AND MOZZARELLA ROTOLINI
products.titleOverview: Award-winning mozzarella wrapped in savory prosciutto
products.overview: Slightly spicy and oh-so-savory.
products.description:
Award-winning mozzarella wrapped in savory prosciutto. 

QUICK FACTS
Country of Origin: United States - Connecticut
Size: 8 oz

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
Creamy mozzarella with a subtle tanginess meets the salty goodness that is prosciutto. This savory combination treats your tastebuds to a harmonious balance of flavors that showcase the timeless beauty of meat and cheese. 

THE STORY
For the better part of a century, Calabro Cheese has been a leader in creating artisanal Italian cheeses in the United States. Using New England farm-fresh milk, each cheese is rBST-free, gluten-free, and Kosher Certified. 

USAGE TIPS
Add to an antipasto plate with sliced prosciutto, peperoncini, olives, artichoke hearts, and pickled veggies.

products.title: BON ANNIVERSAIRE
products.titleOverview: Limited edition cheese with unforgettable flavor.
products.overview: A funky celebration of artisanal cheesemaking.
products.description:
Limited edition cheese with unforgettable flavor.

QUICK FACTS
Country of Origin: United States - Massachusetts 
Milk Type/Treatment: Raw Cow

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
After a decade of love and patience in cheesemaking, the folks at Grey Barn decided to mark their 10th anniversary with a cheese that leaves a big impression. This flavorful stick is bold and stinky but mellow with notes of sweet cream and apricot. Let its silky texture melt in your mouth and get lost in happy thoughts. 

THE STORY
Cheesemaking isn’t for the faint of heart. Grey Barn’s years of dedication to practice and time is what sets them apart from fellow cheesemakers. Their six artisanal cheeses are made by hand on their farm in Chilmark, Massachusetts, using organic milk from cows raised on-site. 

USAGE TIPS
Allow Bon Anniversaire to rest for 30 minutes at room temperature before serving. Pair with dried apricots and an amber ale.

products.title: OMORRO AZORES CHEESE
products.titleOverview: A taste of Portuguese terroir in every sliver.
products.overview: Creamy and lush with an unmistakable tang.
products.description:
A taste of Portuguese terroir in every sliver. 

QUICK FACTS
Country of Origin: Portugal
Milk Type/Treatment: Pasteurized Cow
Rennet Type: Animal

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
Grassy meadows and seaside cliffs don’t just create a stunning backdrop. It’s thanks to the diverse landscape and climate of this Portuguese region that produces a luscious cow’s milk cheese with silky, salty notes set against a bright grassy flavor. Melt-in-your-mouth goodness with a hint of tangy earth to keep you on your toes. 

THE STORY
Nuno Caldeira and his wife Marcia began their cheesemaking journey in 2012. Their family dairy is situated near the natural reserve of Morro del Castelo Branco, where local farms flourish and sustainable practices are essential. In a few short years, their handcrafted cheeses have won the hearts of even the most discerning critics worldwide. 

USAGE TIPS
Spread over a toasted cracker and pair with bright green grapes to balance its decadent flavor.

products.title: COTTONBELL
products.titleOverview: A fresh-faced brie style produced only in the wintertime!
products.overview: An elusive winter brie. Smoothy & creamy.
products.description:
A fresh-faced brie style produced only in the wintertime!

QUICK FACTS
Country of Origin: California, United States
Milk Type/Treatment: Pasteurized Cow
Rennet Type: Animal

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
Smooth, clean, creamy and buttery, this divine winter treat is one that you need to enjoy when it makes its brief appearance every year. Named for the bells the cows wear around their necks, as this is the elusive all-cows-milk winter cheese that the Creamery puts out every year. (Most of their cheeses contain goat's milk; this does not.)

THE STORY
Boxcarr makes Italian-inspired cheeses down in Cedar Grove, North Carolina. These soft-ripened beauties are beloved within the cheese community. Try for yourself!

USAGE TIPS
A wintery brie should receive an equally wintery treatment - bake this in a not-too-hot oven with your favorite adornments on top, ranging from honey to figs to nuts. Add some crackers for dipping and spreading, and a toasty bottle of red wine or a dark beer for some real extra warmth.

 

Please note, ground shipping may be unavailable to select destinations due to the perishability of this delicacy.

products.title: SPRING CHOCOLATE GIFT BOX
products.titleOverview: Assorted varieties of Amedei's most-celebrated dark, milk, and white chocolate bars.
products.overview: A colossal collection of Italy's finest chocolate confections.
products.description:
PRODUCT DESCRIPTION
Assorted varieties of Amedei's most-celebrated dark, milk, and white chocolate bars.

 

QUICK FACTS

Country of Origin: Italy

Size: 2.3 kg

 

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE -

A true chocolate lover appreciates the nuanced flavors of every variety of cocoa-infused creations. That's why we've compiled award-winning confections from one of our favorite Italian chocolatiers. It's the ultimate gift for chocoholics who crave a little bit of everything, and then some.  

 

Each gift box contains: 

Armonie Toscane Milk Chocolate - Creamy milk chocolate with hazelnuts. 

Armonie Toscane White Chocolate Gold - White chocolate with toasted hazelnuts and pistachios. 

Toscano Red - A 70% dark chocolate made with Tuscan cherries, raspberries, and strawberries. 

White Chocolate with Pistachios - Sweet white chocolate sprinkled with pistachios. 

Toscano Blond - A 63% dark chocolate made with Tuscan peaches and apricots. 

1 Fondenti (Contains 36 Napolitains):

Porcelana 70 percent dark  

Blanco de Criollo single-origin Peruvian cacao, 70% dark 

Toscano Black 90% dark chocolate

Toscano Black 70% dark chocolate

Toscano Black 63% dark chocolate 

1 Predime Dark Chocolate Squares with Almonds 

1 Predime Milk Chocolate Squares with Hazelnuts

Armonie Toscane Dark Chocolate Red - A 66% dark chocolate with hazelnuts, pistachios, and almonds. 

 

THE STORY

Amedei shares our culinary pioneering spirit by introducing the world to the very best chocolate you can find. To produce exceptional chocolate, they closely follow the many stages involved in the manufacturing of chocolate. Amedei seeks out the best plantation and cocoa beans, the most authentic "Cru," and works with agricultural expertise and environmental consciousness. Great attention to detail and desire for excellence has earned Amedei the Chocolate Academy of London's prestigious "Golden Bean" award in the "bean to bar." 

 

USAGE 

Share with fellow chocoholics you know and adore.

products.title: FOSSA ARTISAN CHOCOLATES SET
products.titleOverview: Incredible women deserve incredible chocolate. Fossa delivers unique, handcrafted dark and milk chocolate bars, free of additives and responsibly sourced. Sweet and elegant, just like mom. Arrives in jute bag.
products.overview: Quick Overview:
products.description:
PRODUCT DESCRIPTION
Incredible women deserve incredible chocolate. Fossa delivers unique, handcrafted dark and milk chocolate bars, free of additives and responsibly sourced. Sweet and elegant, just like mom.
Arrives in jute bag.

Each set includes:

Sea Salt - Sinful 70% cocoa is blended with a touch of cane sugar and finished with a dusting of sea salt crystals. 

Honey Orchid Dancong Oolong - An award-winning combination of aromatic guava and silky cream blended with cocoa from Tanzania.  

Blueberry Lavender & Oats - Floral and creamy with chewy bits of blueberries and oats throughout. 

Lychee Rose - A stunning celebration of floral flavor and fruity, dehydrated lychee. 
 
About Fossa:
Fossa is Singapore's first bean-to-bar chocolate purveyors. They work with farmers who are dedicated to growing high-quality beans with sustainable methods. Their team roasts, cracks, and winnows each bean by hand before they become the beautiful, refined chocolates you now possess. Thanks to their careful craftsmanship, Fossa bars contain zero additives, letting the cacao's natural beauty shine in each bite.
SKU: FOSS005

products.title: TRAOU MAD PONT AVEN PALET VIP RED TIN
products.titleOverview: Melt-in-your-mouth shortbread cookies you can’t resist!
products.overview: Delightful butter cookies in a collectible tin.
products.description:
PRODUCT DESCRIPTION
Melt-in-your-mouth shortbread cookies you can’t resist! 

QUICK FACTS
Origin: France
Size: 4.5 oz

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
These sweet butter cookies pair well with just about anything! Made with the best Brittany has to offer in fresh butter, each cookie is crisp and flake bite after bite. 

THE STORY
In Brittany, France, “Traou Mad” means “good things”, an apt description for their incredible creations. Back in 1920, Traou Mad started as a humble bakery in Pont Aven and has since grown to share their traditional biscuits with people worldwide. 

USAGE TIPS
Pair with a morning tea or coffee and a dollop of jam.

products.title: AMEDEI UOVO LATTE E NOCCIOLE
products.titleOverview: A show-stopping Easter egg filled with six mini candies.
products.overview: Quick Overview:
products.description:
PRODUCT DESCRIPTION
A show-stopping Easter egg filled with six mini candies. 

QUICK FACTS 
Origin: Italy 
Unit Size: 400 grams

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
Piemonte hazelnuts are the pride of Northern Italy. Combine them with silky-smooth milk chocolate, and your taste buds will sing! Amedei remasters the traditional "Easter Egg" with this sophisticated flavor pairing and fills the inside with six luscious cremino and praline chocolates. 

THE STORY
Amedei shares our culinary pioneering spirit by introducing the world to the very best chocolate you can find. To produce exceptional chocolate, they closely follow the many stages involved in the manufacturing of chocolate. Amedei seeks out the best plantation and cocoa beans, the most authentic "Cru," and works with agricultural expertise and environmental consciousness. Great attention to detail and desire for excellence has earned Amedei the Chocolate Academy of London's prestigious "Golden Bean" award in the "bean to bar." 

USAGE TIPS
Gift to the chocolate-lover in your life, or indulge yourself by pairing with a Brachetto d'Acqui, a slightly sweet red wine from the Piemonte region.

products.title: ISGRO'S TORRONE TIN
products.titleOverview: Nougat and almond goodness.
products.overview:
ISGRO'S TORRONE TIN
Chewy confections you can't resist!
products.description:
PRODUCT DESCRIPTION
Nougat and almond goodness. 

QUICK FACTS
Origin: United States - Pennsylvania 
Unit Size: 1 lb

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
In Italy, tasty torrone (nougat) is a prized achievement--it strikes the perfect balance of chewy and crunchy with a subtle sweetness that never overpowers its natural nuttiness. Isgro's torrone cookies follow a family recipe passed down and perfected year after year.  

THE STORY
Isgro is an Italian Market icon. The family-run bakery has been serving tasty cookies, fresh pastries, cakes, and breads since 1904, when Mario Isgro first emigrated from Messina, Sicily. Four generations later, Mario's same recipes are beloved and sold from his South Philly storefront.

USAGE TIPS
Share with friends over flutes of prosecco after Easter dinner.

products.title: ISGRO'S ALMOND MACAROON TIN
products.titleOverview: Sparkling sugar cookies that don't disappoint.
products.overview: Sweet with a subtle nutty flavor.
products.description:
PRODUCT DESCRIPTION
Sparkling sugar cookies that don't disappoint. 

QUICK FACTS
Origin: United States - Pennsylvania 
Unit Size: 2.5 lb

THE FLAVOR EXPERIENCE
There is something magical about the way Isgro's almond macaroons shimmer in the light. These tasty cookies are made with natural flavoring and dusted with a generous helping of sugar crystals to finish.  

THE STORY
Isgro is an Italian Market icon. The family-run bakery has been serving tasty cookies, fresh pastries, cakes, and breads since 1904, when Mario Isgro first emigrated from Messina, Sicily. Four generations later, Mario's same recipes are beloved and sold from his South Philly storefront.

USAGE TIPS
The perfect accompaniment to a glass of amaretto after a long day.
